p: Hispolon treatment inhibited the invasive capabilities of HeLa and SiHa cells via blocking ERK pathway ( Hsin et al., 2017). Hispolon exerts anti-metastatic effects by the inhibition of uPA (Urokinase plasminogen activator) via the Akt pathway in nasopharyngeal cancer cells ( Ho et al., 2017). By reducing the expression of MMP-2, MMP-9 and uPA, hispolon inhibited the metastasis in SK-Hep1 cells ( Huang et al., 2010). Furthermore, hispolon suppresses invasive potential of cancer cells via EMT inhibition. Therefore, hispolon may be a novel anti-metastatic agent ( Hong et al., 2017). As EMT has close association with drug resistance, further studies should also investigate whether hispolon has potential to sensitize cancer cells towards chemo-drugs.
